title: Iran Plans to Execute Erfan Soltani as Trump Threatens ‘Strong Action’
summary: Rights groups and relatives said Iran planned to put an antigovernment protester to death for the first time during the latest wave of unrest in the country.

title: U.S. Moves Some Personnel From Qatar Air Base as Trump Weighs Military Response to Iran
summary: Nonessential personnel are being removed from Udeid Air Base in Qatar, the main U.S. air operations hub in the region, as President Trump weighs a military response to Iran’s crackdown on protests.

title: Iran’s Leaders May Survive Protests. But Anger Will Likely Persist.
summary: Its security forces have brutally defended the Islamic Republic, but the protests show that many Iranians consider it stagnant and ideologically hollow.

title: Why Greenland Matters for a Warming World
summary: The fate of the world’s largest island has outsize importance for billions of people on the planet, because as the climate warms, Greenland is losing ice. That has consequences.

title: ‘We’re Not Stupid’: What Greenlanders Would Say to Trump
summary: A visit to Greenland reveals a swirl of feelings as people nervously await talks with the Trump administration about the island’s future.

title: Trump’s Threats to Greenland Raise Serious Questions for NATO
summary: The treaty that created NATO did not contemplate an attack by one ally on another. A seizure of Greenland by President Trump would test the endurance of the mutual-defense pact.

title: How ICE Crackdowns Set Off a Resistance in American Cities
summary: In Minneapolis and other cities where federal agents have led immigration crackdowns, residents have formed loose networks to track and protest them.

title: ICE Arrested Dozens of Refugees in Minnesota and Sent Them to Texas, Lawyers Say
summary: The refugees, many of them from Somalia, had passed security screenings before coming to the United States. The Trump administration has vowed to “re-examine thousands of refugee cases.”

title: F.B.I. Searches Home of Washington Post Journalist in a Leak Investigation
summary: It is exceedingly rare, even in investigations of the unauthorized disclosure of classified information, for federal agents to search a reporter’s home.

title: Initial Review Finds No Widespread Illegal Voting by Migrants, Puncturing a Trump Claim
summary: Republican election officials welcome the review, which relies on a federal verification tool, but they say they have not discovered a major problem when it comes to noncitizen voters.

title: An Emboldened Trump Makes Big Bets in Venezuela, Iran and Beyond
summary: President Trump has left himself plenty of room for maximal intervention. But there are a host of potential wild cards, each with risks for the president.

title: Supreme Court Sides With Conservative Congressman in Illinois Election Rules Challenge
summary: The question in the case was not a mail-in ballot rule itself but whether political candidates have the right to challenge the rules governing the vote count in their election.

title: Jodie Foster: An American Oscar-Winner in Paris
summary: In “A Private Life,” the actress takes on her first solo lead role in which she speaks fluent French, but her French connection goes all the way back to childhood.

title: U.S. Refiners to Profit as Trump Asserts Control Over Venezuelan Oil
summary: The companies that turn oil into gasoline and diesel are likely to benefit more, right away, than the businesses that pump oil out of the ground.

title: Venezuela Envoy to Visit U.S. for First Official Trip in Years
summary: Félix Plasencia, an envoy of the interim government, will travel to the United States on the day the opposition leader María Corina Machado is to meet President Trump.

title: Venezuela Announced the Release of Political Prisoners. Families Are Still Waiting.
summary: Hundreds of families are hoping their loved ones will be freed by the Venezuelan government, which has said little about who would be released or when.

title: Can the American Oboe Sing Again?
summary: Building the instrument is hard enough. Turning a profit is a killer. But Jim Phelan is bent on reviving one of the great names in classical music.

title: Tony Dokoupil’s Road Trip on CBS News Hits a Rough Patch
summary: A stretch of big news revealed growing pains for CBS’s new evening anchor and problems with its Bari Weiss-era philosophy.

title: Where Did All the American-Born Roofers Go?
summary: The real story of how immigrant labor came to define the construction industry.

title: Chuck Schumer Calls His Shot
summary: After securing strong recruits on a tough Senate map, the Democratic leader is not only predicting an upset 2026 victory, but also naming the states he thinks his party can flip.

title: Trial to Begin for N.Y.P.D. Sergeant Who Threw Cooler at Fleeing Man
summary: Erik Duran, who fatally struck the man, Eric Duprey, as he fled on a motorbike in 2023, faces charges of manslaughter, assault and criminally negligent homicide.

title: Harper Lee Expanded on Her View of the South in Letters to a Friend
summary: In decades of correspondence, the author gave her friend, JoBeth McDaniel, a mix of opinions, advice on writing and insight into the impact of the Civil Rights movement.

title: Mary Peltola Puts Alaska in Play for Democrats
summary: Mary Peltola’s entry into the Alaska Senate race is a building block in an electoral strategy Democrats have been working on for months.

title: Minneapolis’s Limit
summary: We look at how the actions of federal agents in Minneapolis are impacting life in the city.

title: Do You Have Questions About the New Dietary Guidelines?
summary: We want to help you understand the changes.

title: Lung Cancer Stigma Keeps People From Care
summary: The disease is the rare cancer met with accusations, not sympathy.

title: Jim McBride Dies at 78; Brought Honky-Tonk Back to Country Music
summary: He was best known for his long-running collaboration with Alan Jackson and their signature hit, “Chattahoochee.”

title: Banks Ready Battle Plans to Save Their Credit Card Businesses
summary: “Everything’s on the table,” an executive at JPMorgan Chase said, as the industry seeks to head off President Trump’s effort to cap interest rates.

title: The Swedish Start-Up Aiming to Conquer America’s Full-Body-Scan Craze
summary: Neko Health, backed by the Spotify founder Daniel Ek, plans to open in New York this spring.
